entry.title: Pashinyan suggests in parliament he has no responsibility for Karabakh crisis

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan suggests in parliament he has no responsibility for Karabakh crisis
media:group.media:description:
üìçA senior State Department official has indicated the United States remains willing to mediate between Armenia and Azerbaijan after high-level meetings in Baku. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Nikol Pashinyan again insisted he is not responsible for the Karabakh crisis. üìçThe spokesperson for Russia‚Äôs Foreign Ministry rebuked Armenia for snubbing Moscow-led summits and offers by the Kremlin to mediate negotiations with Azerbaijan. üìçAzerbaijan‚Äôs Ilham Aliyev signed a decree announcing early presidential elections.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Can Armenia emerge as a transport and transit powerhouse?

media:group.media:title: Can Armenia emerge as a transport and transit powerhouse?
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the Civilnet podcast, host Patrick Elliott interviews Hovsep Patvakanyan, Head of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development's Investment Council for Armenia. They discuss the council's vision for transforming Armenia into a regional trade and logistics hub through strategic investments and support for reforms. Patvakanyan shares insights into the challenges facing Armenia as a landlocked country and how the organization plans to help overcome obstacles to unlock greater prosperity.

media:group.media:title: Putin's economic war on Armenia
media:group.media:description:
This week's episode of Insights discusses three major events impacting Armenia - the recent launching of the country's first satellite, the vulnerabilities exposed by the country‚Äôs economic dependence on Russia, and reflections on the passing of Henry Kissinger.
Host Eric Hacopian analyzes the opportunities and strategic insights provided by each development, from advances in STEM fields to lessons for diversifying partnerships and balancing geopolitical influences.

entry.title: Armenian court converts Azerbaijani soldier‚Äôs prison term to life sentence

media:group.media:title: Armenian court converts Azerbaijani soldier‚Äôs prison term to life sentence
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijan‚Äôs Ilham Aliyev insisted he is willing to sign a normalization agreement with Armenia in the near future, even while blaming Yerevan for delays in the peace process. üìçAn Armenian court converted the 20-year prison term given to an Azerbaijani soldier who murdered an Armenian civilian in April to a life sentence, according to sources in the judiciary who confirmed the development to CivilNet on condition of anonymity. üìçThe head of the United Nations‚Äô nuclear agency confirmed Armenia‚Äôs sole nuclear power plant meets international safety standards, saying he is ‚Äúvery confident in this matter.‚Äù
